reasoning: Urothelial carcinoma accounts for 90% of bladder cancers with well-documented global incidence ~10 per 100k from cancer registries (GLOBOCAN 2005). Specific histological subtype with strong epidemiological data.

Rare genetic skeletal dysplasia syndrome with tarsal and carpal bone fusion. Extremely rare autosomal recessive condition with scattered case reports, estimated <0.1 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological data available.

CMV seroprevalence is 40-80% globally, but active/symptomatic infection incidence is much lower (~2-3 per 100k in general population, higher in immunocompromised). Conservative estimate for clinically significant CMV disease based on surveillance data. High geographic and age variation.

SLE incidence varies by ethnicity (0.5 per 100k in Caucasians, up to 6-8 per 100k in African/Asian populations). Global average approximately 4-5 per 100k. Well-documented in rheumatological registries and epidemiological studies.

Aggregate BOTEC estimate for Type 3 variant of familial juvenile hyperuricemic nephropathy. Rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder, fewer than 100 documented cases worldwide, <0.01 per 100k births. Limited published incidence data.
